title: Create Netflix-style movie recap script viewer

requirements.text: Create a homepage with a Netflix-inspired hero section featuring a prominent movie recap with title, description, and call-to-action button

quotes: the interface and FLOW, ui/ux SHOULD REPLICATE THE EXACT OF NETFLIX

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section displays a featured movie recap with large background image
Title and description overlay on hero image
Primary CTA button (e.g., 'Read Recap') is prominently displayed
Visual styling matches Netflix's dark theme and layout proportions

requirements.text: Implement horizontal scrollable rows of movie cards organized by categories (e.g., 'Trending Recaps', 'Action Movies', 'Drama', 'Comedy')

quotes: the interface and FLOW, ui/ux SHOULD REPLICATE THE EXACT OF NETFLIX

acceptanceCriteria: Multiple category rows displayed vertically on homepage
Each row contains horizontally scrollable movie cards
Cards show movie poster thumbnail and title
Smooth horizontal scroll interaction
Hover effects on cards (scale up, show additional info)

requirements.text: Create a top navigation bar with logo, browse menu, search icon, and user profile section matching Netflix's navigation design

quotes: the interface and FLOW, ui/ux SHOULD REPLICATE THE EXACT OF NETFLIX

acceptanceCriteria: Fixed navigation bar at top of page
Logo/brand name on the left
Navigation links (Home, Categories, My List) in center
Search and profile icons on the right
Background transitions from transparent to solid on scroll
Navigation remains visible and accessible at all times

requirements.text: Build a movie detail page that displays the full recap script in a readable format with movie metadata (title, genre, year, duration)

quotes: it gives you the recap script of the movie

acceptanceCriteria: Detail page shows movie title, year, genre, and estimated reading time
Full recap script displayed in readable typography
Background features movie poster or backdrop image
Back navigation to return to browse view
Recap text is formatted with proper paragraphs and spacing

requirements.text: Create a backend data model to store movie information including title, genre, year, poster image URL, backdrop image URL, and recap script text

quotes: it gives you the recap script of the movie

acceptanceCriteria: Movie record stores all required metadata fields
Recap script stored as text field
Support for categorization/tagging
Query methods to retrieve movies by category
Method to retrieve individual movie details by ID

requirements.text: Implement search functionality that filters movies by title and displays results in a grid layout similar to Netflix search results

quotes: the interface and FLOW, ui/ux SHOULD REPLICATE THE EXACT OF NETFLIX

acceptanceCriteria: Search input in navigation bar
Real-time filtering as user types
Results displayed in grid layout
Each result shows movie poster and title
Clicking result navigates to detail page
Empty state when no results found

requirements.text: Add a 'My List' feature allowing users to save movie recaps for later reading with persistent storage

quotes: the interface and FLOW, ui/ux SHOULD REPLICATE THE EXACT OF NETFLIX

acceptanceCriteria: Add/remove button on movie cards and detail pages
My List page displays all saved movies
List persists across sessions
Visual indicator shows when movie is in list
List accessible from navigation menu

requirements.text: Implement responsive design that adapts the Netflix-style layout for mobile, tablet, and desktop screens

quotes: the interface and FLOW, ui/ux SHOULD REPLICATE THE EXACT OF NETFLIX

acceptanceCriteria: Movie card rows adapt number of visible items based on screen width
Navigation collapses to hamburger menu on mobile
Hero section scales appropriately on all devices
Touch-friendly interactions on mobile devices
Maintains Netflix-style aesthetics across all breakpoints

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive dark theme visual design inspired by Netflix's aesthetic including color palette (deep blacks, reds for accents), typography hierarchy, and spacing patterns

quotes: the interface and FLOW, ui/ux SHOULD REPLICATE THE EXACT OF NETFLIX

acceptanceCriteria: Dark background (near-black) as primary color
Red accent color for primary actions and branding
Clean, modern sans-serif typography
Consistent spacing and padding throughout
Subtle shadows and depth effects on cards
Smooth transitions and animations

requirements.text: Seed the backend with sample movie data including titles, metadata, and recap scripts for at least 20 movies across multiple genres
acceptanceCriteria: At least 20 sample movies with complete data
Movies distributed across 4-5 different genres
Each movie has a recap script of appropriate length
Variety of release years represented
Sample data can be easily loaded on initialization

constraints: Must use React with TypeScript for frontend
Must use Motoko for backend in single-actor architecture
Must use Tailwind CSS for styling
Cannot use real Netflix API or copyrighted Netflix assets
nonGoals: Social features like sharing or comments

required: Dark cinematic hero background image for featured movie section (hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
Logo icon for navigation bar with red accent (logo.dim_200x80.png)
Sample movie poster for action genre (poster-action-1.dim_300x450.png)
Sample movie poster for drama genre (poster-drama-1.dim_300x450.png)
Sample movie poster for comedy genre (poster-comedy-1.dim_300x450.png)
Sample movie poster for thriller genre (poster-thriller-1.dim_300x450.png)
Sample movie backdrop for detail page (backdrop-1.dim_1280x720.png)
